business.headline: 100 crore Indians have no extra money to spend: ReportA report by a venture capital firm, Blume Ventures, says India's 'consuming class' comprises roughly 140 million people. But about 1 billion (100 crore) Indians do not have the kind of incomes to be able to spend anything on discretionary good.

Government plans Universal Pension Scheme: Who will benefit?The ministry of labour and employment is working on the proposed plan, which is expected to bring existing pension schemes under one framework.

Explained: Why European Union wants India to cut tariffs on cars, wineApart from trade, the EU also sees India as an important security partner, given rising cyber threats and tensions in regions like the South China Sea and the Indo-Pacific.
Azad Engineering launches Rs 700 crore QIP: All you need to knowThe company's board approved the opening of the issue on February 25 for the QIP of equity shares with a face value of Rs 2 each.

Volkswagen only carmaker to wrongly classify car imports: Tax authoritiesIndia says Volkswagen used a clandestine scheme to import auto parts in separate shipments, to evade detection and cut taxes, instead of declaring items as "completely knocked down", or CKD, units that face higher taxes of 30% to 35%.
Gold, stocks, or property: Which investment can make you richer?More people are turning to stocks, gold, and real estate to grow their wealth, but choosing the right one can be tricky.

Capgemini CEO on ideal workweek: Not 90, not 70, not even 50 hoursCapgemini India's CEO, Ashwin Yardi, has introduced a different perspective, one that supports a more balanced approach in the debate about work-life balance and working hours in a week.

Defence stocks like BEL, HAL are in a slump. Is it an opportunity to buy? Even after the drop, analysts remain bullish about defence stocks. In the case of BEL, 24 out of 27 analysts have a 'buy' rating on the stock. Most analysts also remain positive about HAL's stock.

Tesla shares tumble nearly 9%, market value dips below $1 trillion. Here's whyTesla share price: The decline followed data from the European Automobile Manufacturers Association, which reported Tesla's sales in Europe fell 45% in January.

Tata Motors shares down 44% from 52-week high. Should you buy the dip?Tata Motors shares: In the previous trading session, the stock closed lower 1.2% lower at Rs 660.30. So far this year, it's lost over 11%. In six months, it's down 40%. Over a year, it's fallen 30%.

RBI eases lending rules for small borrowers and NBFCs. Here's what it meansThe RBI has also put on hold its earlier proposals to increase the capital that banks must set aside for new project loans and the liquidity they need to maintain for digital deposits.

New India Co-op Bank vault had 12 times its capacity on paper: Report The Mumbai Police's Economic Offences Wing (EOW) is probing an alleged Rs 122-crore embezzlement at the bank and has arrested three people so far, including two former senior executives of the lender.

entertainment.headline: Sex Education actor Alexander Westwood jailed for 15 years for sex offensesSex Education actor Alexander Westwood received a 15-year prison sentence for multiple sex offenses. The case has captured widespread media attention due to Westwood's role in the popular Netflix show.

Aashram 3 Part 1 ending explained: Will Pammi's revenge end Baba Nirala's reign?With Aashram Season 3 Part 2 releasing on February 27, let us take a look at how the season ended on a cliffhanger with Baba Nirala's misuse of power and a change in dynamics.

Amit Trivedi says Jasleen Royal's opening act for Coldplay was 'unfortunate'Amit Trivedi, in an interview with India Today Digital, discussed the controversy over Jasleen Royal's opening act for Coldplay's India tour and whether it would impact on the image of Indian artists.

Rapper Kanye West trying to save marriage with Bianca Censori: ReportKanye West is reportedly trying to prevent his marriage with Bianca Censori from ending. An insider reveals that Bianca is considering divorce, and Kanye is panicking.

Singer Palash Sen on working with Akshay Kumar, not being 'accepted' by BollywoodEuphoria's lead vocalist Palash Sen spoke to India Today Digital about collaborating with Bollywood star Akshay Kumar on the song Mahakal Chalo, work opportunities in the Hindi film industry, and more in an exclusive interaction.

Actors Aman Verma and Vandana Lalwani to separate after 9 years of marriageActors Aman Verma and Vandana Lalvani are separating after nine-years of marriage. Amid growing speculation, Aman has addressed the rumours about their relationship.

Baalveer actor Dev Joshi marries girlfriend Aarti, first pics outBaalveer actor Dev Joshi married his girlfriend Aarti in a beautiful ceremony. The wedding festivities, including haldi and mehndi, were spectacular and captured in stunning photos.

Be Happy: Abhishek Bachchan, Inayat Verma series to stream in MarchThe streaming date of Abhishek Bachchan and Inayat Verma-starrer Be Happy is out. It promises to be a touching film about a single father's journey to support his daughter's dream of performing on a dance reality show.

A Man on the Inside: Ted Danson's charming comedy deserves more loveA Man on the Inside is a warm and witty series which tackles multiple subjects, including loss, new beginnings and, well, crime. The Ted Danson-starrer is currently streaming on Netflix.

Shreya Ghoshal on Chikni Chameli: Embarrassed when 5-year-old girls sing itShreya Ghoshal says she feels embarrassed when young girls sing Chikni Chameli, stressing that lyrics should be written more thoughtfully, as music and films have a deep impact on society.

Hina Khan updates fans about cancer treatment: My chemo and surgery are overHina Khan recently gave an update about her cancer treatment. The actor mentioned that her chemotherapy and surgery are over.

Tanmay Bhat jokes about Ranveer Allahbadia ignoring his textsTanmay Bhat hilariously addressed the India's Got Latent controversy, joking about Ranveer Allahbadia ignoring his texts. The reaction video left fellow comedians laughing and also "triggered" them.

general news.headline: Afghanistan knock England out of Champions Trophy in last-over thrillerChampions Trophy 2025: Afghanistan beat England by eight runs at the Gaddafi Stadium in Lahore to stay alive in the competition. They also knocked the Three Lions out of the competition.

Let's see how it goes: Shashi Tharoor to attend Congress meet of Kerala leadersAmid speculation about his political future and reports of internal dissent, Congress MP Shashi Tharoor will attend a crucial party meeting in Delhi to discuss Kerala politics and 2026 Assembly elections.

India blasts Pak at Geneva meet over Kashmir remarks: In no position to lectureIndian diplomats at the Geneva meeting asserted that instead of its "unhealthy obsession" with India, Pakistan should focus on providing actual governance and justice to its own people.
Mumbai Police closes fraud case against real estate developers Rakesh Wadhawan, sonThe case involved allegations of illegal sale of office units in the Kaledonia commercial tower in Andheri East.
The Olive Ridleys are back!Every year, thousands of Olive Ridley turtles return to Odisha's shores, following a migration older than empires.

Pune woman raped inside state transport bus, Uddhav Sena workers vandalise depotA 26-year-old woman was allegedly raped inside a stationary bus at Pune's Swargate depot. Authorities have suspended 23 security guards, while police intensify the manhunt for accused Datta Gade.

100 crore Indians have no extra money to spend: ReportA report by a venture capital firm, Blume Ventures, says India's 'consuming class' comprises roughly 140 million people. But about 1 billion (100 crore) Indians do not have the kind of incomes to be able to spend anything on discretionary good.

Memories of Maha Kumbh: How 3 million foreigners will remember the onenessOf the 650 million devotees at the Maha Kumbh 2025 in Prayagraj, 3 million were visitors from abroad. From a sense of security and being comfortable despite a massive crowd to an overwhelming feeling of oneness, foreigners narrate their Kumbh experience. For many, the Kumbh Mela was their primer to understanding India and Indians.
Gossip Girl actor Michelle Trachtenberg dies at 39Michelle Trachtenberg, best known for her roles in Gossip Girl and Buffy the Vampire Slayer, died at the age of 39.

England knocked out, can Afghanistan qualify for semfinals from Group B?Afghanistan beat England by eight runs in the ICC Champions Trophy 2025 which has kept them alive in the tournament as they're in contention to make it to the semi finals. Here's how they can reach the last four in the event.

Washington Post Opinion Editor quits as Jeff Bezos sets goals for 'new chapter'In a post on X, Jeff Bezos clarified that while The Washington Post would continue to explore a variety of topics, perspectives opposing these core values would no longer find a place in its opinion pages.

DMK slams Zoho founder: Teach Hindi to your staff, not students in Tamil NaduDMK spokesperson Saravanan Annadurai hit back at Zoho founder Sridhar Vembu, questioning why Tamil Nadu students should learn Hindi for business needs. Annadurai told the CEO, "Teach Hindi to your staff if your business needs it."

Video: Car runs over child playing in Ghaziabad society, driver flees spotThe driver failed to notice the young child playing nearby, leading to the unfortunate accident. An FIR has been registered, and police are investigating the incident.

'Tower, how'd that happen?': Chilling ATC audio of near-miss at US airportA Southwest Airlines passenger plane nearly collided with a business jet during a landing attempt at Chicago's Midway airport. Air traffic control audio of the incident has raised troubling questions about the role of the private jet pilot.

Centre defends law on convicted politicians: 6-year ban avoids 'undue harshness'The central government told the Supreme Court that a lifetime ban on convicted politicians is a legislative matter, arguing that existing disqualification rules ensure deterrence while maintaining proportionality and fairness.

India conducts flight trials of first-of-its-kind naval anti-ship missileDefence Research & Development Organisation (DRDO) and the Navy successfully tested NASM-SR, a cutting-edge naval missile with in-flight retargeting and advanced guidance, marking a big milestone in India's indigenous defence capabilities.

One last time? Morse code on MS Dhoni's T-shirt sparks retirement speculationIPL 2025: MS Dhoni arrived in Chennai on Wednesday to join the Super Kings camp. A Morse code on Dhoni's T-shirt has created a stir on social media, intensifying speculation about his retirement.

Debt or drug use? Police stumped about motive in Kerala mass murder caseKerala police are investigating the motive behind five shocking murders, focusing on financial debt rather than drug abuse. The accused, 23-year-old Afan, confessed to the crimes, but remains hospitalised, while authorities probe digital evidence and financial records.

CBSE Class 10 to have 2 board exams in 2026? Pros and cons explained  CBSE's proposal for two Class 10 board exams has sparked a debate over student well-being, teacher workload, and logistics. While some see flexibility, others fear it adds pressure. Will this reform ease academics or complicate the system further?
From Sangam jal delivery to virtual dip: How Maha Kumbh 2025 went digitalMaha Kumbh 2025 was a mix of tradition and technology.

Urvashi Rautela becomes 'first woman to be pushed' by Orry, Ananya Panday reactsUrvashi Rautela once again recreated Dabidi Dibidi with Orhan Awatramani. In a video shared by Orry himself, he is seen accidentally pushing the actor, sparking online reactions.

Government plans Universal Pension Scheme: Who will benefit?The ministry of labour and employment is working on the proposed plan, which is expected to bring existing pension schemes under one framework.

That's only 4: Musk's cheeky reply to man's explicit email on work log ultimatumElon Musk's no-nonsense cost-cutting spree, which has been backed by President Donald Trump, has led to mass resignations and deep divisions within the administration. It has also generated a rather colourful response from one employer.

Cocktails with Netanyahu, gold statue: Bizarre AI video of Trump's Gaza Earlier this month, Donald Trump made a shock announcement, saying that the US would "take over and own" the Gaza Strip and develop the besieged Palestinian enclave as "Riviera of the Middle East".
Gossip Girl actor Michelle Trachtenberg dies at 39Michelle Trachtenberg, best known for her roles in Gossip Girl and Buffy the Vampire Slayer, died at the age of 39.

Priyamani on hate over interfaith marriage: People said our kids would join ISISPriyamani has opened up about the online hate she and her husband Mustafa Raj face due to their interfaith marriage. Despite getting married in 2017, the couple continues to deal with negative comments and baseless accusations.

Another Simple Favor teaser: Blake Lively, Anna Kendrick reunite for more dramaThe teaser for Another Simple Favour is out and it witnessed the reunion of Anna Kendrick's Stephanie and Blake Lively's Emily on the Italian island of Capri.

Ananya Panday calls father Chunky's choice of clothes questionableActor Ananya Panday shares a warm and sweet bond with father and actor Chunky Panday. She recently opened up about Chunky's fashion and their debate over film scripts in a new interview.

sports.headline: All-round Nat Sciver-Brunt fires as Mumbai Indians hammer UP WarriorzWPL 2025: Nat Sciver-Brunt scored an unbeaten 75 and picked up three wickets as Mumbai Indians beat UP Warriorz by eight wickets on Wednesday to go to the top of the points table.

Thrilled by Afghan win, Ravi Shastri fires sharp message to England: No excusesFormer India head coach Ravi Shastri and other fans and pundits congratulated Afghanistan following their stunning win over England in the ICC Champions Trophy 2025. Afghanistan beat England by eight runs to knock them out of the tournament.

England knocked out, can Afghanistan qualify for semfinals from Group B?Afghanistan beat England by eight runs in the ICC Champions Trophy 2025 which has kept them alive in the tournament as they're in contention to make it to the semi finals. Here's how they can reach the last four in the event.

Aaqib Javed gets irritated by India match questions ahead of Bangladesh fixturePakistan's head coach Aaqib Javed got irritated by questions about India vs Pakistan match during the pre-match press conference ahead of their last fixture in the ICC Champions Trophy 2025 against Bangladesh.

Bangladesh assistant coach expects good performances from batters vs PakistanBangladesh assistant coach Muhammad Salahudin said that they will have to bat well in order to beat Pakistan in their last fixture of the ICC Champions Trophy 2025.

Pakistan fan shows love for Virat Kohli by printing his name and jersey number on bikeA Virat Kohli fan in Pakistan went out of his way to show his love for the India star as he printed his name and jersey number on his bike. Kohli recently scored a century against Pakistan in the Champions Trophy 2025, which was widely celebrated across the border.

Fakhar Zaman refutes retirement rumours, wants to play Test cricketChampions Trophy 2025: Fakhar Zaman said that he has no intentions of retiring from the game, also expressing his wishes to represent Pakistan in Test cricket.

Pakistan vs Bangladesh, all you need to know: Lahore pitch report, live streamingPakistan and Bangladesh are all set to lock horns in their respective last fixtures of the ICC Champions Trophy 2025 on Thursday, February 27 in Rawalpindi. Both teams will be eager for a win, having not been able to win a single match in the tournament so far.

If Kohli scored century in Pakistan, he'd receive same love as India: Mohammad AmirFormer Pakistan fast bowler Mohammad Amir said that Virat Kohli wouldn't have been able to differentiate between Pakistan and India, had he scored his century in Pakistan instead of Dubai. Kohli scored an unbeaten 100* (111) against Pakistan to help India win by six wickets in Champions Trophy 2025.

Danish Malewar, Karun Nair help Vidarbha recover on Day 1 Ranji Trophy 2024-25: Karun Nair and Danish Malewar helped Vidarbha finish Day 1 of the final against Kerala at 254 for four at the VCA Stadium in Nagpur. Malewar stayed not out on 138 at Stumps on the opening day.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
